newsitem.title: FRANCE: TAT airline attendants plan 24-hour strike.
newsitem.headline: TAT airline attendants plan 24-hour strike.

text.p: The union representing airline attendants working for British Airway's French airline unit TAT European Airlines on Tuesday announced a 24-hour strike for Wednesday to protest against under-staffing.

"The hostesses and stewards of the company, 100 percent owned by British Airways, plan to protest against chronic under-staffing and the precariousness of their work contracts," the Syndicat National du Personnel Navigant Commercial said in a statement.
A union spokeswoman said the airline had some 300 flight attendants. She said the strike would start at midnight local time. (midnight GMT)
Earlier this month, the airline's pilots staged a strike.
A spokesman for the airline could not be reached for comment.
